title: Calories in Shrimp Cocktail
meta_description: Discover calories in shrimp cocktail per serving, including protein, carbs, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard serving: ~100 g boiled shrimp + 30 g cocktail sauce (ketchup, horseradish, lemon); no added garnishes.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by shrimp size, sauce recipe, brand, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One serving of shrimp cocktail has ~150 kcal and ~20 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one serving of shrimp cocktail?
faqs.a: About 150 kcal for a standard serving with sauce.

faqs.q: Is shrimp cocktail high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~20 g protein per serving from the shrimp.

faqs.q: What's the carb count in shrimp cocktail?
faqs.a: Around 10 g carbs, mostly from the cocktail sauce.

faqs.q: Does shrimp cocktail have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, ~650 mg per serving, mainly from the sauce.

faqs.q: How to make shrimp cocktail lower calorie?
faqs.a: Opt for less sauce, light versions, or plain boiled shrimp.
